meanings.definition: Move up and down as if on a seesaw.
meanings.sent1: The children were seesawing at the playground.
meanings.sent2: The boat was seesawing on the rough waves.
meanings.sent3: The seesawing motion of the swing made the little girl giggle.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were seesawing between joy and sadness.
meanings.sent5: The seesawing motion of the pendulum was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: Change rapidly and repeatedly from one position, situation, or condition to another.
meanings.sent1: The stock prices were seesawing throughout the day.
meanings.sent2: Her mood was seesawing between excitement and nervousness.
meanings.sent3: The seesawing weather kept everyone guessing.
meanings.sent4: The seesawing opinions in the meeting made it hard to reach a decision.
meanings.sent5: The seesawing relationship finally stabilized after many ups and downs.
